result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul H Bidwell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Paul H Bidwell in court, in custody, with Attorney Mark E. Kershek.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for plea and sentencing.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.   State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Kershek makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  30 DAYS JAIL             **CONCURRENT WITH PRESENT SENTENCE (Milwaukee County case) ** 

COSTS:  $243.00 (to be paid forthwith, alternate 5 days jail, concurrent, if not paid)
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 12, 2015 at 09:30 am.
courtroom C-162

Attorney Mark E. Kershek in court.   Defendant Paul H Bidwell did not appear.   Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is in custody at House of Corrections.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.   Clerk of Courts Office to prepare Order to Produce from Milwaukee House of Corrections.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 12, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on May 28, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Paul H Bidwell in court, in custody, with Attorney Mark E. Kershek.   Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kershek requests an adjourned date for plea and sentence as Defendant is now in custody and he needs to meet with Defendant. Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Motion to forfeit bail granted.
Hearing on May 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Paul H Bidwell in court with Attorney Mark E. Kershek.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Becky Van Dam appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kershek requests a short adjournment.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Bail/Bond Forfeiture
Hearing on April 10, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Paul H Bidwell in court, in custody, with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Hearing scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
Bail/Bond Review on March 23, 2015 at 07:45 am.

Case called at 9:05 a.m.  Defendant Paul H Bidwell not in court.  Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State requests a capias.  Court issues a capias.  Bail is ordered revoked and forfeited.
Hearing on February 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant to have no contact with Natalie W. listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Paul H Bidwell in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.   Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Hearing scheduled for February 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
